ratings.comment: Everyone says general chem is hard and it is, but Dr. Trate honestly was really amazing and made lectures understandable. I would definitely choose to have her as a professor again if I could.

Dr. Trate's lectures were alright but didn't help much with learning content. The textbook, working with classmates, and piazza were more helpful. Dr. Block provided great answers on piazza and many of Trate's students attended his lectures or watched online. Overall the class is ok as long as you ask a lot of questions(especially on labs)

I loved talking with her during her office hours, she's easy to talk to and helpful with the weekly graded homework and Podias. The earlier lectures were fine, but myself and others felt confused in some later lectures and ended up attending Block's lectures instead of or in addition to Trate's lectures.
Dr. Trate teaches Chem 109 rather blandly- it's not very engaging. She isn't unreasonable to students, but she doesn't stand out as an effective teacher either.

Professor Trate talks very fast in lectures and doesn't always answer questions very clearly, which can make it hard to understand what is going on in lecture. Honestly I didn't get much out of lectures, discussions, or labs for this class, it mostly came down to reading the textbook. I would highly recommend reading the textbook!!

Block is the better lecturer, so I would recommend watching his lectures online if you're confused. Trate isn't a bad professor however, and before watching Block's lectures I was doing well in the class just off of Trate's instruction. She summarizes the textbook whereas Block reformats the lesson and applies things in new ways.

Trate is alright, her lectures were kind of disorganized at times and some of her explanations were lackluster. I ended up learning primarily from the textbook and YouTube. During class, there are in-class activities to do for a participation grade, but they work well for understanding potential exam questions.

Trate was okay, she is a nice person and she obviously has to deal with a lot of complaining students. but her lectures can be confusing. I would recommend going to her class and then watching Blocks lectures as well. Overall, not huge opinions about her but wouldn't recommend.

If you can, take the class with Dr. Block. Dr. Trate is a nice lady, but her lectures were useless and I just ended up watching Block's online. Like someone else said, she repeats the textbook but worse and will restate what she just said instead of actually answering questions. *Mandatory attendance only for most dis and labs

Prof. Trate is a decent lecturer- sometimes she does cool demonstrations in class. However, she mostly just covers the textbook, which is well-written (you must read it to do well). This is an intensive class! There are assignments nearly every day with strict deadlines. That said, if you enjoy or excel at chemistry, you can succeed in 109.

Awful professor.  If you have the ability, I would take Dr. Block's lecture instead of hers.  I ended up going to his  lectures and watching them online because Dr. Trate was unorganized, and lacked passion and enthusiasm for the class.

The lectures were completely useless, just explained the textbook readings but in a worse way. Would not answer questions, just answer in circles and be unkind to students who asked questions. You are better off not going to lectures and watching Block's instead online.

Dr. Trate was a pretty great professor! Sometimes, it was a little confusing being able to understand certain topics, but she was able to really explain it well when asked again to reiterate. Also, she was always available during office hours and has a great personality. I would definitely take a class with her again if offered.

Class and tests are based very heavily on the textbook. Lectures don't cover any really important information, she just talks around what the textbook says and doesn't explain any of the concepts well. You'll do fine if you put in the work, just dont expect to be helped much.

Really nice but lectures just rehash the textbook reading and are totally unnecessary. Lots of work for chem 109 but pretty lenient grader. Class moves super fast and lectures were usually behind the reading.
She just reads the textbooks and barely teaches us. My grades went up not going to classes.

Sometimes approachable, but was not much help since she always seemed annoyed and uninterested. It was her first time teaching 109 and it showed. 109 is hard as is, but it didn't help to have a prof that was so unclear and often contradicted herself.having a GOOD TA is the only way to get by. HARD EXAMS. super textbook heavy.

Chem 109 is a hard class no matter the professor. Lectures were somewhat helpful but the online textbook helped with most of the learning as lectures were only there to talk about big picture topics. Dr. Trate was lively in lecture and very approachable.

Dr. Trate was able to explain the material well and even when the material was confusing she was available outside of class, in-person and through email to further clarify the concepts explored in-class. Furthermore, her advice helped me to improve my methods of study which improved my test grades throughout the semester.

Dr. Trate's lecture was absurd because she basically repeated the text in a high-pitched voice. Her lecture did not help me at all. I got an A only by looking at the textbook and recalling what I had done in AP chem a year earlier.

Chem 109 was a hard class, but it's not impossible to get an A. Professor Trate was not the best at explaining bigger concepts or answering questions from people in lecture, but if you get her one on one she is pretty good at breaking things down. I often found myself watching the lectures of professor Block for extra clarity.

Good professor, approachable, solid understanding of terms and concepts but sometimes misses the point in explaining them, always talks about cats.
Course is hard, do ur preclass readings(I didn't and it kinda backfired), exam-heavy. Homework is tedious but does not affect grade by much, same goes for labs.

Did not seem to care about teaching and looked unexcited at lectures. Basically copied the textbook and lecture slides from other professors in class so attending was pointless most of the time. Friendly as a person but could sometimes be rude and condescending when asked questions during lectures.

Lectures were very difficult to listen and pay attention to, I never really got a lot out of them. She never teaches much content that is actually on exams, you just have to do the pre-class notes proficiently. She seems nice overall but does get very sassy when people ask a question she doesn't want to answer.

Didn't get much out of lectures, felt like it was just repeating info from the preclass readings. A couple grading categories have "lowest # dropped" to help grade. You need to study. Be ready to work. Friendly and approachable, happy to help and clarify ideas. Always do your preclass participation work. Submit even if confused: some credit > none.

Dr. Trate was overall okay. Her lectures were extremely hard to pay attention to and I would say barely helped as they were so boring. She had little expression or excitement, seemed like she didn't want to be there anymore than us.The class takes a ton of work and her lectures didn't really solidify any knowledge for me.
Dr. Trate is a solid choice for CHEM 104. Her tests are really hard though - you're going to have to study! She is very kind and accommodating, really wants her students to succeed.

Had lots of examples during lecture but make sure that you practice the discussion homework and the sample exams. Trate likes to work through problems during lectures and apply concepts from the book which I thought was helpful. She does care about how you do in the class so if you have questions just ask her for help.

The class overall is hard if you don't put the effort into learning the material. You have to come a little prep before with at least some knowledge to understand fully what's happening in lecture. Class experience really comes down to who you have as TA but I would say the professor is pretty helpful outside of class and has nice lecture examples

I really liked Trate's lectures and thought how she approached problems to be very helpful/clear. She went over pre-class material more in depth, but I think that's just how Chem 104 is designed. She went around class to help with problems and is very considerate in making sure you get questions answered and understand the material in office hours.

Chem 104 is pretty straightforward and Dr. Trate did a good job. It felt as if lectures were optional review sessions and discussion was the mandatory segment due to weekly quizzes. Plenty of review materials and fair exams. Dr. T is responsive and helpful if you ask questions. I would say your experience in her class depends more on your TA!

Pretty much the same difficulty as CHEM103. Although I liked her better as a professor and person than my professor for CHEM103. Chemistry is obviously just hard in general but if you take notes on the textbook and put some effort into lectures you will be just fine.

Dr Trate is very nice but not a good lecturer. Its boring to sit in her class bc she basically just gives practice problems and then gives the answer and rarely explains how/why. We were told 50% of our learning would be outside of class, its more like 100%. She basically repeats all the preclass hw we do in lecture. Hard exams, nice curve though.
She is a good teacher for chemistry 104 but it is a difficult class. She makes herself very accessible to help outside of lecture.

Knows what she is teaching, but is not a great lecturer. Puts up problems and gives way too much time to do them, then rushes through the explanation of the problem so that you don't even have time to write down. Doesn't explain how to do the problem before it is presented. Her lectures are not helpful at all. I watch a lot of videos to get grades.
